Home > external > metacyc > getModelFromMetaCyc.m

getModelFromMetaCyc

PURPOSE

getModelFromMetaCyc

SYNOPSIS

function metaCycModel=getModelFromMetaCyc(metacycPath,keepTransportRxns,keepUnbalanced,keepUndetermined)

DESCRIPTION 

 getModelFromMetaCyc
   Retrieves information stored in MetaCyc flat files and generates a super model


   metacycPath         this defines the path of a local of dump of MetaCyc data files.
                       By default, the MetaCyc Matlab files (metaCycRxns, metaCycMets
                       and metaCycEnzymes) are in the RAVEN\external\metacyc directory
                       and the MetaCyc-based draft model can be directly generated by
                       setting this parameter as empty (default ''). Alternatively,
                       this function attempts to re-generate the Matlab files from a
                       local dump of MetaCyc data files (enzrxns.dat, proteins.dat,
                       compounds.dat, reactions.dat, and pathway-links.dat)
   keepTransportRxns   include transportation reactions, which often have identical
                       reactants and products that turn to be all-zero columns in
                       the S matrix (opt, default false)
   keepUnbalanced      include reactions cannot be unbalanced reactions, usually
                       because they are polymeric reactions or because of a
                       specific difficulty in balancing class structures
                       (opt, default false)
   keepUndetermined    include reactions that have substrates lack chemical
                       structures or with non-numerical coefficients (e.g. n+1)
                       (opt, default false)

   metaCycModel        a model structure generated from MetaCyc database
                       including all reactions and metabolites in MetaCyc

   PLEASE READ THIS: This function allows user to update the MetaCyc database from
   a local dump of data files, which can be freely accessed by subscribing to MetaCyc
   (https://metacyc.org/download.shtml)

   Usage: getModelFromMetaCyc(metacycPath,keepTransportRxns,keepUnbalanced,keepUndetermined)

   Hao Wang, 2017-12-05

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
  • getEnzymesFromMetaCyc getEnzymesFromMetaCyc
  • getMetsFromMetaCyc getMetsFromMetaCyc
  • getRxnsFromMetaCyc getRxnsFromMetaCyc
This function is called by:
  • getMetaCycModelForOrganism getMetaCycModelForOrganism

SOURCE CODE

0002 % getModelFromMetaCyc
0003 %   Retrieves information stored in MetaCyc flat files and generates a super model
0004 %
0005 %
0006 %   metacycPath         this defines the path of a local of dump of MetaCyc data files.
0007 %                       By default, the MetaCyc Matlab files (metaCycRxns, metaCycMets
0008 %                       and metaCycEnzymes) are in the RAVEN\external\metacyc directory
0009 %                       and the MetaCyc-based draft model can be directly generated by
0010 %                       setting this parameter as empty (default ''). Alternatively,
0011 %                       this function attempts to re-generate the Matlab files from a
0012 %                       local dump of MetaCyc data files (enzrxns.dat, proteins.dat,
0013 %                       compounds.dat, reactions.dat, and pathway-links.dat)
0014 %   keepTransportRxns   include transportation reactions, which often have identical
0015 %                       reactants and products that turn to be all-zero columns in
0016 %                       the S matrix (opt, default false)
0017 %   keepUnbalanced      include reactions cannot be unbalanced reactions, usually
0018 %                       because they are polymeric reactions or because of a
0019 %                       specific difficulty in balancing class structures
0020 %                       (opt, default false)
0021 %   keepUndetermined    include reactions that have substrates lack chemical
0022 %                       structures or with non-numerical coefficients (e.g. n+1)
0023 %                       (opt, default false)
0024 %
0025 %   metaCycModel        a model structure generated from MetaCyc database
0026 %                       including all reactions and metabolites in MetaCyc
0027 %
0028 %   PLEASE READ THIS: This function allows user to update the MetaCyc database from
0029 %   a local dump of data files, which can be freely accessed by subscribing to MetaCyc
0030 %   (https://metacyc.org/download.shtml)
0031 %
0032 %   Usage: getModelFromMetaCyc(metacycPath,keepTransportRxns,keepUnbalanced,keepUndetermined)

0034 %   Hao Wang, 2017-12-05

0037 if nargin<1
0038     metacycPath='';
0039 end
0040 if nargin<2
0041     keepTransportRxns=false;
0042 end
0043 if nargin<3
0044     keepUnbalanced=false;
0045 end
0046 if nargin<4
0047     keepUndetermined=false;
0048 end
0049 
0050 %First get all reactions
0051 metaCycModel=getRxnsFromMetaCyc(metacycPath,keepTransportRxns,keepUnbalanced,keepUndetermined);
0052 fprintf('MetaCyc reactions loaded\n');
0053 
0054 %Get reaction and enzyme association
0055 metaCycEnzymes=getEnzymesFromMetaCyc(metacycPath);
0056 fprintf('MetaCyc enzymes loaded\n');
0057 
0058 %Replace rxnNames with those from metaCycEnzymes
0059 [a, b]=ismember(metaCycModel.rxns,metaCycEnzymes.rxns);
0060 a=find(a);
0061 b=b(a);
0062 metaCycModel.rxnNames(a)=metaCycEnzymes.rxnNames(b);
0063 
0064 %Create the rxnGeneMat for the reactions, by geting all enzymes and
0065 %corresponding subunits
0066 rxnNum=numel(metaCycModel.rxns);
0067 metaCycModel.genes=metaCycEnzymes.enzymes;
0068 metaCycModel.rxnGeneMat=sparse(rxnNum,numel(metaCycEnzymes.enzymes));
0069 metaCycModel.grRules=cell(rxnNum,1);
0070 
0071 %Loop through all reactions to generate rxnGeneMat matrix and grRules This
0072 %step also cross-link reactions to their catalyzing enzymes
0073 for i=1:rxnNum
0074     
0075     metaCycModel.grRules{i}='';
0076     %Find out if this is an enzymatic reaction
0077     [a, b]=ismember(metaCycModel.rxns(i),metaCycEnzymes.rxns);
0078     if a
0079         I=[];   %Find out all catalyzing enzymes, which are treated as isoenzymes
0080         I=find(metaCycEnzymes.rxnEnzymeMat(b,:));
0081         if ~isempty(I)
0082             
0083             grRule='';
0084             for j=1:numel(I)
0085                 
0086                 subgrRule=''; %Find out if enzyme complex
0087                 [c, d]=ismember(metaCycEnzymes.enzymes(I(j)),metaCycEnzymes.cplxs);
0088                 if c   %In cases of an enzyme complex
0089                     %With single subunit
0090                     if numel(metaCycEnzymes.cplxComp{d}.subunit)==1
0091                         subgrRule=metaCycEnzymes.cplxComp{d}.subunit{1};
0092                         %With multiple subunits
0093                     else
0094                         subgrRule=strjoin(metaCycEnzymes.cplxComp{d}.subunit,' and ');
0095                         subgrRule=strcat('(',subgrRule,')');
0096                     end
0097                     [x, geneIndex]=ismember(metaCycEnzymes.cplxComp{d}.subunit,metaCycModel.genes);
0098                     metaCycModel.rxnGeneMat(i,geneIndex)=1;
0099                     
0100                 else  %In cases of NOT an enzyme complex
0101                     subgrRule=metaCycEnzymes.enzymes(I(j));
0102                     metaCycModel.rxnGeneMat(i,I(j))=1;
0103                 end
0104                 
0105                 %Generating grRules
0106                 if ~strcmp(subgrRule,'')
0107                     if ~strcmp(grRule,'')
0108                         grRule=strcat(grRule,{' or '},subgrRule);
0109                     else
0110                         grRule=subgrRule;
0111                     end
0112                 end
0113                 
0114             end
0115             if iscell(grRule)
0116                 metaCycModel.grRules{i}=grRule{1};
0117             else
0118                 metaCycModel.grRules{i}=grRule;
0119             end
0120             
0121         end
0122         
0123     end
0124 end
0125 
0126 %Then get all metabolites
0127 metaCycMets=getMetsFromMetaCyc(metacycPath);
0128 fprintf('MetaCyc compounds loaded\n');
0129 
0130 %Add information about all metabolites to the model
0131 [a, b]=ismember(metaCycModel.mets,metaCycMets.mets);
0132 a=find(a);
0133 b=b(a);
0134 
0135 if ~isfield(metaCycModel,'metNames')
0136     metaCycModel.metNames=cell(numel(metaCycModel.mets),1);
0137     metaCycModel.metNames(:)={''};
0138 end
0139 metaCycModel.metNames(a)=metaCycMets.metNames(b);
0140 
0141 if ~isfield(metaCycModel,'metFormulas')
0142     metaCycModel.metFormulas=cell(numel(metaCycModel.mets),1);
0143     metaCycModel.metFormulas(:)={''};
0144 end
0145 metaCycModel.metFormulas(a)=metaCycMets.metFormulas(b);
0146 
0147 if ~isfield(metaCycModel,'metCharges')
0148     metaCycModel.metCharges=zeros(numel(metaCycModel.mets),1);
0149 end
0150 metaCycModel.metCharges(a)=metaCycMets.metCharges(b);
0151 
0152 if ~isfield(metaCycModel,'inchis')
0153     metaCycModel.inchis=cell(numel(metaCycModel.mets),1);
0154     metaCycModel.inchis(:)={''};
0155 end
0156 metaCycModel.inchis(a)=metaCycMets.inchis(b);
0157 
0158 if ~isfield(metaCycModel,'metMiriams')
0159     metaCycModel.metMiriams=cell(numel(metaCycModel.mets),1);
0160 end
0161 metaCycModel.metMiriams(a)=metaCycMets.metMiriams(b);
0162 
0163 if ~isfield(metaCycModel,'keggid')
0164     metaCycModel.keggid=cell(numel(metaCycModel.mets),1);
0165 end
0166 metaCycModel.keggid(a)=metaCycMets.keggid(b);
0167 
0168 %Put all metabolites in one compartment called 's' (for system). This is
0169 %done just to be more compatible with the rest of the code
0170 metaCycModel.comps={'s'};
0171 metaCycModel.compNames={'System'};
0172 metaCycModel.metComps=ones(numel(metaCycModel.mets),1);
0173 
0174 
0175 %It could also be that the metabolite and reaction names are empty for some
0176 %reasons. In that case, use the ID instead
0177 I=cellfun(@isempty,metaCycModel.metNames);
0178 metaCycModel.metNames(I)=metaCycModel.mets(I);
0179 I=cellfun(@isempty,metaCycModel.rxnNames);
0180 metaCycModel.rxnNames(I)=metaCycModel.rxns(I);
0181 
0182 end
